features: 👍[Upgraded Motion Sensor Under Cabinet Lights]: Setting the under cabinet lights on motion sensor mode, they auto-on when human motion is detected within 120°and 10ft in a dark or low light environment, and auto-off after about 20 seconds of no motion detected. No longer have to worry about tripping on the step in the dark trying to turn on the switch.

👍[Always-on Mode]: The under counter lights for kitchen can be also be set to be always-on, or off. The always-on feature allows you use the motion sensor lights on daytime for a long time task. It can be used in reading, camping and as a flashlight.

👍[Upgraded Dimmable Closet Lights]: The cabinet lights are bright and eye-protection, thanks to 40pcs energy-saving LEDs and a glare-free frosted cover. In addition, unlike fixed brightness of others', our motion sensor light indoor has 5 levels of brightness. So the dimmable under cabinet lighting allows you to brighten them for task like meal preparation and dim them for a motion sensor night light without waking other people up at midnight.

👍[USB-C Rechargeable Under Cabinet Lights Wireless]: These under cabinet lights built-in a 1800mAh rechargeable battery and can be easily recharged via type-C cable. Don’t worry about wiring, available outlets or battery replacement like other styles. One full charge can last up to 7-30 days on Motion Sensor Mode(depends on how often you use) and 6 hours on Always-on Mode at 100% brightness. Note that the USB wall adapter is not included.

👍[Easy Installation & Wide Usage]: With built-in strong magnets, these closet lights are easy to install, no need for an electrician. It can be adsorbed directly on ironwork surfaces. Or use the included adhesive metal plates to stick on anywhere you want. That also means it’s easy to take off and put back on when it needs a charge. Great under counter lights for kitchen, clooset, cupboard, pantry, basement, stairs, hallway, bookshelf, etc.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Are you in pain of stumbling around to find the light switch in the dark? Are you looking for some lights to brighten up your cabinet, dark pantry and closet where an electric outlet is not available? If so, convenient rechargeable motion sensor closet lights will be a smart solution. MCGOR Wireless Motion Sensor Under Cabinet Lights will turn on automatically when you close to cabinet and closet and eliminate dangling cords or unsightly plugs. Bring great convenience to your life.

What Makes MCGOR Motion Sensor Light Indoor Unique? ✔️40 LED: The under cabinet lighting includes 40 LED beads which emit 180 lumens of soft, diffused white light. Provide sufficient light to illuminate every dark corner. ✔️Three Modes: Alway-on mode, Motion sensor mode, Turn off mode. Always On Mode: The cabinet light will provide spotlighting wherever and whenever you need it. You can use it on daytime or night Motion Sensor Mode: The motion sensor night light will auto-on when human motion is detected within 120°and 10ft, and auto-off after about 20 seconds of no motion detected. No longer have to worry about tripping on the step in the dark trying to turn on the switch. NOTE: This feature only works in a dark or low light. ✔️Adjustable Brightness: 10%, 25%,50%, 75%, 100% settings, or long press button to stepless dimming, meet different lighting needs. ✔️Rechargeable Battery: Built-in 1800 mAh rechargeable battery and convenient usb-c charging port. No battery replacement. No wiring or drilling. ✔️High-Quality Material: Made of high-quality aluminum alloy, better heat dissipation, more durable under counter lights for kitchen ✔️Easier to Install Than A Light Socket: 2 installation ways: via built-in magnets or 3M adhesive metal plates, you can mount these under cabinet lights wireless in ironwork surface and other clean and flat surfaces.

Wide application The motion sensor night light is ideal for use in cabinet, closet, wardrobe, cupboard, bathroom, corridors, hallway, stairs, basements, pantry and baby room among other places. 2 x Motion Sensor Closet Light 2 x USB Cable 6 x Adhesive iron plate 1 x User Manual If you have any question, please tell us, we will provide professional service to solve all your problems.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars These are great!
reviews.reviewText: Few reasons to give this a 5 star.1) I appreciate no batteries needed. It has a cord with USB port for charging2) they are held up with magnet strips w/adhesive back. So you can take the lights off and on and don't have to be too exact when positioning under the cabinets. Made for super easy install - Also makes for easy RE charging. It has a button that is red while charging and turns green when fully charged.3) the motion detector works well. it is a little slower than would like, but overall pretty reactive.4) you have different levels of brightness, which I loved having the control over - under cabinetry was more dim, or closet area where i prefer brighter light, adjusting was easy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice, bright rechargeable motion-sensing LED lights
reviews.reviewText: These are bright, rechargeable, motion-sensing LED lights that are super easy to install. They feel high-quality and I highly recommend them. I will buy more! They're nice and thin, so they're perfect for installing in tight spaces or if you want them to be hidden.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Mostly great product with a strange quirk…
reviews.reviewText: I own three sets of these. They work very well. The motion detection is very good. The light is a very cool white (think moonlight, not sunlight), which is crucial because I get migraines from warm light. It’s adjustable to five (maybe four) brightness levels. But they’re in a strange order. It doesn’t cycle brightest to dimmest or vice versa. It gets brighter then dimmer and back again, making it very hard to keep track of what brightness level you’re on. It’s a very brightness-by-vibes thing. I’ve only changed the brightness on my lights right out of the box, so it’s annoying for about a minute per light, then not again. If you’re planning on doing something else, this could be a major annoyance. The on/off/auto (auto = motion detect setting) button is a very small, poorly-marked slide lever. I took three different color permanent markers and colored over the word “on” in green, “off” in black, and “auto” in blue for all of them. That solves the labeling issue very nicely. I just discovered a very strange thing that may prove to be a real and un-solvable issue: a charging bug.Tl;dr here is these lights will sometimes charge with some cords and sometimes won’t. If the red light doesn’t come on, even if you know the cord/setup works with other devices, it’s not actually charging.The full story: I charged all six lights out of the box with my usb-c tablet charging cord. All six glowed red on the motion detection dome while charging, then lasted a long time. It’s been over two weeks on the motion detect setting and I just had to recharge a light for the first time. (It gets noticeably dimmer when it needs charging, it doesn’t just conk out on you.) I plugged it into the same usb-c cord I initially charged all the lights with and that I had just used to charge my tablet last night. Also the same charging brick, power strip, apartment and location within the apartment as the initial setup. No red light. I unplugged and replugged and still no light. I plugged my tablet into it and it started charging. I Replugged into the light again and again no red light. I thought maybe it only happened the first time for some reason or maybe the battery was just too low, so I left it there for over an hour. I checked it and the light was still very dim. It hadn’t been charging. Took it inside and plugged it into the usb-c in the kitchen, red light immediately on. Brought that cord into the living room to switch with the first usb cord and the red light didn’t go on. Checked the kitchen cord with the tablet and it works. Got one of the tiny usb cords out of the light box and that worked in both places immediately. No idea why these would charge correctly sometimes and not others, but be very aware of the red light.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Comes as a pair. Charges quickly. Using one to light a basement stairwell with the other in reserve. It's been going on and off religiously at least 4-5 times a day for 3 weeks and still hasn't required recharging.Has two short charging cords, extra magnetic mounting plates, screws and decent instructions. The light is bright and adjustable. The motion detector is sensitive enough to do the job but not annoying. And the light turns off in 30 seconds or so if unattended. Excellent value!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great motion light with dimmer
reviews.reviewText: Nothing bad to say here. The magnet in them is very strong. Worked great inside of my safe. Battery life is phenomenal. Theyre solid and have a good weight to them. The dimmer button is an awesome touch!If you’re mounting directly to something magnetic just simply attach. Or if you need light elsewhere, the mounting plates are easy to install.Ordering another set for the toolbox!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I needed lights in my stereo cabinet to illuminate my albums. These were very easy to install, look good and do the job. The "auto" mode is excellent -- the motion sensor turns on the light when I open the cabinet door and then turns off in about 15 seconds after it's closed. I liked them so much I bought two more for other cabinets. I was concerned about recharging but that's no problem since they're magnetic. So once you mount the metal plates, the light is easily comes on and off. Tip - - The plates are already installed on the back and it appears they are adhered - they're not - - just pull them off for installation - - they're only magnetically placed there.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sleek and versatile
reviews.reviewText: The package contains 2 lights and 2 charging cords and enough self stick magnetic mounts for 3 locations so you can move them from spot to spot. I bought these for under my kitchen wall cabinets and they work well. I can relocate one of them as needed. They are thin so you do not see them tucked up under framed cabinets. The light isn’t super bright but bright enough for reading a cookbook or doing tasks. They charge very quickly and you can either turn them off and on as needed or set the auto feature which works well. I'm very happy with them.
